isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If previously removed, install the corresponding snap rings in the I.D. of the mainshaft gears.
Secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks, pilot end of the shaft down ( Figure 183). If previously removed, install the roll pin in the keyway.

figure.caption: Figure 183. Secure Mainshaft in Vise Equipped With Brass Jaws or Wood Blocks

step1.para: Install the 3rd speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of washer up. Rotate washer in the 1st or bottom groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft ( Figure 184). Install the key in the mainshaft keyway to lock the washer in place.

figure.caption: Figure 184. Install 3rd Speed Gear Limit Washer on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft against the washer ( Figure 185).

figure.caption: Figure 185. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Install the 3rd speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with external splines of the spacer ( Figure 186).

figure.caption: Figure 186. Install 3rd Speed Gear on Mainshaft

note.para: Gear limit washers are internally splined and locked to mainshaft by the key. Gear spacers are externally splined to engage with clutching teeth in gear hubs. There is one limit washer and one spacer for each gear in the mainshaft assembly.

step1.para: Setting Correct Axial Clearance for Mainshaft GearsAxial Clearance (End-Play) Limits Are: .005" - .012" for all mainshaft gears.
Washers are used to obtain the correct limits; six thicknesses are available as follows:

note.para: New style tolerance washers come in a full range of tolerances as corresponding colors listed above "+ red." (Example: "Orange plus red" limit washer has an inch limit thickness of .258-.260.)

step1.para: Always use the .248-.250 tolerance washer (White or White plus red) in the reverse, LO and 2nd speed gear positions as shown in Figure 187.

figure.caption: Figure 187. Always Use .248-.250 Tolerance Washer in Reverse, LO and 2nd Speed Gear Positions

important.para: Refer to the appropriate illustrated parts list (specified by model series) to ensure that proper parts are used during reassembly of the transmission.

step1.para: Install the 2nd speed gear on the shaft against the 3rd speed gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 188).

figure.caption: Figure 188. Install 2nd Speed Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Install the spacer in 2nd speed gear, engaging the external splines of the spacer with the clutching teeth of the gear ( Figure 189).

figure.caption: Figure 189. Install Spacer in 2nd Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the 2nd speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer down and against the spacer. Rotate the washer in the 2nd groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and re-insert key in the keyway to lock the washer in place (inset, Figure 190).

figure.caption: Figure 190. Remove Key From Keyway and Install 2nd Speed Gear Limit Washer

step1.para: Insert two large screwdrivers between the 2nd and 3rd speed gears to check axial clearances ( Figure 191). Apply slight downward pressure on screwdriver handles to spread gears evenly. Making sure the gear hubs are parallel, insert a feeler gauge between the hubs. Correct axial clearance is less than the minimum .005" to .012". If the clearance is less than the minimum .005" tolerance, the limit washer in the 2nd speed gear should be replaced by a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the clearance checked is greater than the maximum .012" tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed in the 2nd speed gear. This would decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

figure.caption: Figure 191. Check Axial Clearances

step1.para: Install the 1st-2nd speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of the sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft ( Figure 192).

figure.caption: Figure 192. Install 1st-2nd Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the 1st speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate washer in the 2nd groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and reinsert key in the keyway to lock the washer in place ( Figure 193).

figure.caption: Figure 193. Remove Key and Install 1st Speed Gear Limit Washer

step1.para: Install the spacer and 1st speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 194).

figure.caption: Figure 194. Install Spacer and Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the LO speed gear on the shaft against the 1st speed gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 195).

figure.caption: Figure 195. Install LO Speed Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Install the spacer in LO speed gear, engaging the external splines of the spacer with the clutching teeth of the gear ( Figure 196).

figure.caption: Figure 196. Install Spacer in LO Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the LO speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer down and against the spacer. Rotate the washer in the 4th groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and re-insert the key in the keyway to lock washer in place ( Figure 197).

figure.caption: Figure 197. Remove Key and Install LO Speed Gear Limit Washer

step1.para: Check axial clearances and make adjustments, if necessary, between the LO and 1st speed gears as described in step 9 of this section ( Figure 198).

figure.caption: Figure 198. Check Axial Clearances

step1.para: Install the LO-Reverse speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft ( Figure 199).

figure.caption: Figure 199. Install LO-Reverse Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the reverse gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate the washer in the 5th groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and reinsert key in keyway to lock washer in place ( Figure 200).

figure.caption: Figure 200. Remove Key and Install Reverse Gear Limit Washer

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft against the washer ( Figure 201).

figure.caption: Figure 201. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Install the reverse gear on the mainshaft. Engage the clutching teeth of the gear with the splines of the spacer and sliding clutch and move the reverse gear against the LO speed gear ( Figure 202).

figure.caption: Figure 202. Install Reverse Gear on Mainshaft

note.para: Do not replace reverse gear internal snap ring at this step.

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft assembly from the vise. Align the missing internal spline of the 3rd-4th speed sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft and install on the front of the shaft, engaging the external splines of the sliding clutch with the clutching teeth of the 3rd speed gear ( Figure 203).

figure.caption: Figure 203. Install 3rd-4th Speed Sliding Clutch
